lines.text: Uh, I'm not very hungry; just gimme a double Polar Burger wit' everything and a cherry soda wit' chocolate ice cream.

Men are rats, listen to me, they're fleas on rats, worse than that, they're amoebas on fleas on rats. I mean, they're too low for even the dogs to bite. The only man a girl can depend on is her daddy.
Peachy keen, jellybean.
Sandy!
Tell me about it, stud.
What do you guys think of Sandy? Do you think we can let her into the Pink Ladies?
Nah, she looks to pure to be pink!
My parents want to invite you over for tea on Sunday.
I don't like tea.

[laughing]
You don't have to drink tea.
I don't like parents.
I've got so many hickies people will think I'm a leper.
Relax... A hickie from Kenickie is like a Hallmark card, when you only care enough to send the very best!
You pig!
Oh, I love it when you talk dirty!
Do you think these glasses make me look smarter?
No, you can still see your face.

[singing]
I don't steal and I don't lie / But I can feel and I can cry / A fact I bet you never knew / But to cry in front of you / That's the worst thing I could do.
Doody, how do I look?
Like a beautiful blonde pineapple!
You're looking good, Riz.
Eat your heart out.
But sloppy seconds ain't my style.

Thank you, fans and friends and odds and ends. And now, for you gals and guys, a few words to the wise. You Jims and Sals are my best pals. And to look your best for the big contest, just be yourselves and have a ball. That's what it's all about, after all. So, forget about the camera and think about the beat. We'll give the folks at home a real big treat. Don't worry about where the camera is, just keep on dancin', that's your biz. Hey, if I tap your shoulder, move to the side. Let the others finish the ride! This is the event you've all been waiting for, the National Dance-Off. And away we go with Johnny Casino and the Gamblers!

[singing]
I got chills / They're multiplyin' / And I'm losing control / Cause the power you're supplying / It's electrifyin'.
Geez! Every teacher I got this year has flunked me at least once!
Yeah and if you don't watch it, you're gonna be spending all your time in McGee's office
Yeah well this year she's gonna wish she's never seen me
Oh yeah? and what are you gonna do?
I just ain't gonna take any of her crap that's all. I don't take no crap from nobody
Sonny?
Oh, Hello ma'am
Aren't you suppose to be in homeroom right now?
I was just going for a walk
You were just dawdling weren't you?
Yes ma'am
That is no way to start a new semester Mr. LaTierre
Va fa napoli, tutte puttana
Perhaps a session of banging erasers after school would put you on the right track?
Yes ma'am
Are you just going to stand there all day?
Uh no ma'am, I mean yes ma'am, I mean I'm just um...
Well which is it, yes or no?
No ma'am
Good! Then MOVE!
Yes Ma'am
I'm sure glad you didn't take any of her crap Sonny, you would of really told her off huh?

[Danny is trying out for wrestling and smoking a cigarette]
All right, let's trying cutting it to two packs a day. Now, you have to change.
Well, yeah. That's why I'm here, ya know? To change.
No, I mean your clothes.
Oh.
You mean you're dropping out of Rydell?
I don't look at it as dropping out! I look at it as a very strategic career move.
It doesn't matter if you win or lose, it's what you do with your dancin' shoes.
Hey Rizzo, I hear you're knocked up.
You do huh? Boy, good new really travels fast.
[shoots Marty a look of contempt]
Hey listen, why didn'tcha tell me?
What's it to ya?
Anything I can do?
You did enough!
I don't run away from my mistakes
Don't worry about it Kenickie, it was somebody else's mistake.
Thanks a lot kid.
[Kenickie walks away]

[calls out to Kenickie]
Any time...
What's up, Kenickie?
One guess.
[Rizzo and Kenickie are making out in Kenickie's car, crawling into the backseat together]
Oooh, Riz... Riz...
Would you call me by my first name?
Ooohh, uhhh... ooohh... uhh...
Betty.
Betty, Betty...
[says her name several times, in increasing passion]
Hey... ya got something?
Are you kidding?
[Sits up and gets a condom out of his wallet]
My 25-cent insurance policy.
Big spender!
[Kenickie opens the condom packet, is shocked as he finds it broken]
What?
It broke!
How could it break?
I bought it when I was in the seventh grade.
[the two spend a long nervous moment considering the situation, but look to each other with growing lust]
What the Hell...
[Rizzo grabs Kenickie, and they resume making out]

[muffled]
Oh Betty...

[nervously]
I think there's more to you than just fat.

[sincerely]
Thanks.

[singing]
Well they couldn't teach you anything/ You think you're such a looker/ But no customer would go to you/ Unless she was a hooker.
That's cool baby, you know how it is, rockin' and rollin' and what not.
Danny?
That's my name, don't wear it out.
What's the matter with you?
What's the matter with me, baby, what's the matter with you?
What happened to the Danny Zuko I met at the beach?
Well I do not know. Maybe there's two of us. Why don't you take out a missing person's ad? Or try the yellow pages, I don't know.
You're a fake and a phony and I wish I never laid eyes on you!
They call me Cha Cha because I'm the best dancer at St. Bernadette's.
With the worst reputation.
Look who's coming. Patty Simcox, the bad seed of Rydell Hi-
[to Patty]
Hi.
Oh I just love the first day of school, don't you?

[sarcastically]
It's the biggest thrill of my life.
Hey, they just announced the nominees for student council this morning and guess who's up for vice president?
Who?
ME. Isn't that the most? To say the least?
The very least.

[singing]
Look at me, I'm Sandra Dee / Lousy with virginity / Won't go to bed 'til I'm legally wed / I can't, I'm Sandra Dee.

[breaks out a bottle of wine]
How about a little Sneaky Pete to get the party going?
[the girls all cheer]
I got Twinkies. Anybody want one?
Twinkies and wine? Oh, that's real class, Jan.
It says right here it's a dessert wine.
[offers bottle to Sandy who's hesitant]
What's the matter? We don't got cooties!
I'll bet you've never had a drink before either, have you?
Oh, yes I did. I had some champagne at my cousin's wedding once.
Well, ringa ding-ding.
Hey Zuko! I've got a surprise for you.
Oh, Yeah?

[chuckles]
Yeah

[throws Sandy in front of him]
Sandy!
Danny!
Wha-what are you doing here, I thought you were moving back to Australia?
We were but we had a change in plans!
[His friends stare at Danny with a strange face and he changes moods, pretending like he doesn't care]

[after telling Marty that she thinks she might be pregnant]
Marty, you ain't gonna tell anybody about this, right?
I'll take it to the grave.

[Marty turns and pushes her way past people, Rizzo following her]
Coming through, coming through. Lady with a baby.

[suggesting possible dates for dance]
What about Rudy from the Capri Lounge?

[annoyed]
Get serious!
It's just a suggestion.
Well, I already called him.
Where are you goin'? To flog your log?
Much better than hanging around here with you dorks.
Oh, bite the weenie, Riz.
With relish.
The rules are... there ain't no rules!

[after Marty tells Sonny Riz is pregnant, Sonny spreads the news to others]
Rizzo got a bun in the oven.

[Sonny spikes the punch, teacher chaperone turns to watch Sonny]
What are you doing?
Washing my hands.
I wish I had a guardian angel to tell me what to do. You know, like Debbie Reynolds had in "Tammy." What do you think?
If you find him, give him my phone number.
He was sort of special.
There ain't no such thing.

[reading list of dance rules]
All couples must be boy-girl.
Too bad, Eugene!
Blanche, do you have the schedules?
Yes Ms. McGee, I just had my hands on them.
Oh good, they'll be nice and smudged.
Oh here they are. If they would have been a snake they would have bitten me.
Blanche, these are the schedules we had for last semester. Maybe next year you'll find the ones for this semester.
Ok, so what do you guys think this is a gang bang?
Yeah, you wish.

Attention seniors. Before the merriment of commencement commences, I hope that your years with us here at Rydell have prepared you for the challenges you face. Who knows? Among you there may be a future Eleanor Roosevelt or a Rosemary Clooney, and among you young men, there may be a Joe DiMaggio, a President Eisenhower, or even a Vice-President Nixon. But you will always the glorious memories of Rydell High. Rydell forever. Bon voyage.

We have pictures of you so-called mooners. And just because the pictures aren't of your faces doesn't mean we can't identify you. At this very moment those pictures are on their way to Washington where the FBI has experts in this type of identification. If you turn yourselves in now, you may escape a Federal charge.
[Frenchy and Sandy are in the bathroom; Frenchy is about to pierce Sandy's ears]
Sandy, Sandy, beauty is pain.
[Sandy screams; Frenchy sticks her head out of the bathroom]
Could you please get me some ice to numb her earlobes?
Why don't you just let the cold water run, and stick her ear under the faucet?
Oh!
[goes back inside]
Beauty-school sure wasn't as I thought it would be.
Nothing ever is.
Hey guys, look!
Ladies and gentlemen! Dingleberries On Parade!
Yeah
[football player gets his foot stuck in his helmet]
Hey, look! You really put your foot into it this time, Chisum!
Yeah, try hopscotch, you hot dog!

[laughter]
What a gavone! Gumdrops, man.
Well you know, these girls are only good for one thing.
Yeah, what are you suppose to do with them the rest of the 23 hours and 45 minutes of the day?

[With a serious but confused face]
Is that all it takes 15 minutes?
[the guys slap him on the head]
When a guy picks a chick over his buddies, something's gotta be wrong. Come on, guys let's go for some pizza.
Your a fake and a phony and I wish I never laid eyes on you.
Why, this car is Auto-matic. Its System-matic. Its Hyyyyydro-matic. Why, its Greased Lightning!
You're cruisin' for a bruisin'

[Kenickie, Rizzo and Frenchie are left alone at the diner]
Oh, great. I get stuck with the check again.
[Looks at Rizzo]
Gimme money.
[Rizzo glares at him]
Okay, what's with you tonight, huh? You got the personality of a wet mop!
Don't start with me!
Oh, sure! Fine! Eureka! How 'bout I finish with ya, huh?
Finish this!
[She throws her milkshake in his face, and then throws him his T-Bird jacket]
To you from me, PinkyLee! Sorry, French.

[Chasing after Rizzo]
Hey! Rizzo! I wanna talk to you! NOW!
I'm not taking any of her crap, that's all, I'll take no crap from nobody.
When I hear music, I just can't make my feet behave.
Thinks she's Tinkerbell.
Hush, Sonny.
You know, if we fix up this car, it could be make-out city, you know that.
Right, the chick is gonna have to put out before she even gets in.
[the T-Birds have just pulled into the driveway of Frenchy's house, where the girls are having a slumber party]
Hey Putzie, why don't you call her?
[Putzie looks unsure, then leans forward, gesturing dramatically]
Oh, Sandy. Wherefore art thou, Sandy?
I think we all owe a round of applause for Patty Simcox and Eugene Felsnick and committee for their beautiful decorations.
Let's hear it for the toilet paper!
In just a few moments the entire nation will be watching Rydell High, God help us, and I want you to all be on your best behavior.
NO HINEY BITING!

[after Danny has failed at wrestling, basketball, and baseball]
Well, you know, there are a lot of other sports that don't require any physical contact.
Oh, yeah? Like what?
Like, uh... track!
Whaddaya mean, like running?
Not just running! Something that needs endurance! Something that needs stamina! Like, long-distance running! Cross-country running!
That could be cool.
If you can't be an athlete, be an athletic supporter.

[the girls just convinced Sandy to try a cigarette, she does but starts coughing a lot from it]
Ooh... I should've told you! You shouldn't inhale if you're not used to it!
Sandy, let me show you how to French inhale! It's really cool, watch!

[Frenchy starts inhale the smoke from her cigarette through her nose]
That is the ugliest looking thing I ever saw.
Yeah, the guys really go for it! I mean that's how I got my nickname Frenchy!
Sure it is!
[Frenchy gets a little offended and play hits Rizzo on the leg]
Frenchy, I don't feel so good.
Think of it this way, if she screws you up she can always fix your hair so your ears don't show.
What if they dance diffently than we do back home?
Hey don't worry, maybe you'll invent the kangaroo bop.
Vi, what do you think of waitressing?
You're too young to know.
Don't let me near the refreshment stand!
Take my money away from me! I'm not hungry! I'M NOT HUNGRY!
You can't just walk out of a drive-in.

[Danny is trying to make out with Sandy]
No, Danny!
Sandy, don't worry about it, nobody's watching.
Danny, get off me!
Come on, Sandy, what's the matter with you? I thought I meant something to you!
Meant something to you! You think I'm going to stay here with you in this? this sin wagon? You can take this piece of tin!
[throws his class ring at him and runs away]
Sandy, you just can't walk out of a drive-in!
What's with you tonight?
I feel like a defective typewriter.
Huh?
I skipped a period.
Think you're P.G.?
[first lines]
I'm going back to Australia; I might never see you again.
Don't... don't talk that way, Sandy.
But it's true! I've just had the best summer of my life, and now I have to go away. It isn't fair.
[Danny starts kissing her]
Danny, don't spoil it!
It's not spoiling it, Sandy, it's only making it better.
Danny... is this the end?
Of course not; it's only the beginning.
Oh you MUST think I'm a terrible clod for not introducing myself to your friend!... Hi, I'm Patty Simcox...
[moves to sit down]
Welcome to RydELL OH!
[sits on Jan's apple. Jan removes it as Patty sits down and shoots dirty look at Rizzo and Marty]
...well I hope you'll be at cheerleader tryouts. We'll have so much fun and get to be life-long friends!
Are you making fun of me, Riz?
Some people are so touchy.

[struggling with the cotton candy]
How many?
One.
Hi, I'm Vince Fontaine, I'm judging the dance contest.
I don't think I'm entered.
A knockout like you? What's your name?
Marty.
Marty what?
Maraschino. You know, as in cherry.
I've been dieting all day! My mom's apple pie is better than this stuff! do you want some?
SURE!
[They start heading out when Sonny stops him]
Hey Putzie... 15 minutes!
[He starts laughing and Putzie leaves]
The problem's in this rubber band engine.
The problem's in your mouth.
Kenickie, got any Scotch tape?
That's my name, don't wear it out.
You've gotta make friends with the cameraman.
The cameraman?
Yeah, his name's Ted.

[as Sonny, Doodie, and Putzie moon the television audience during National Bandstand]
I wonder who that is on the right?

[continuing with dance rules]
Anyone doing tasteless or vulgar movements will be disqualified
Well, that leaves us out!
Let's keep it clean, people. Let's keep it clean.
